definition: to receive sb/to grant an interview
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: Australian Liberal Democratic Party's President Huang Zhaoqiang met and praised Zhao for his philanthropic undertaking.
sentences.chinese: 澳洲自民黨主席黃肇強都接見並表揚了趙尚陽的善舉。

sentences.english: The managing director agreed to receive a deputation from the factory.
sentences.chinese: 總經理同意接見工廠派來的代表團。

sentences.english: He requested that the premier grant him an internview.
sentences.chinese: 他要求那位總理接見他一次。

sentences.english: If you would like to know more about my ability, I can be available for an interview at any time convenient to you.
sentences.chinese: 倘若您願意接見本人以瞭解我的能力，我將隨時侯教。

sentences.english: The Dean, Prof. Huang Liwen, welcomed the Dutch delegation leaded by Mr.
sentences.chinese: 學院院長黃立文教授等領導熱情接見客人。

sentences.english: You may rely on it that he will come to meet you.
sentences.chinese: 你放心好了，他會來接見你的。

sentences.english: The chief manager is not receiving callers today.
sentences.chinese: 總經理今天不接見客人。

sentences.english: Workers' Party (WP) reaching out to the constituents of Aljunied GRC.
sentences.chinese: 工人黨走訪阿裕尼集選區，接見選民。

sentences.english: He received us in the drawing-room.
sentences.chinese: 他在客廳裏接見了我們。

sentences.english: The team will also meet with Queen Beatrix in the Hague.
sentences.chinese: 荷蘭隊還將在海牙受到貝婭特麗克絲女王的接見。

sentences.english: The Duke, a butterfly enthusiast, agreed to meet Farrell.
sentences.chinese: 這位公爵是個蝴蝶愛好者，他同意接見法雷爾。

sentences.english: Vice Chairman Raidi of the NPC Standing Committee accompanied Wu during the visit and meeting.
sentences.chinese: 全國人大常委會副委員長熱地陪同參觀和接見。

sentences.english: The chief's house contained an audience room forty feet square .
sentences.chinese: 酋長的房裏有一個接見室，四十英尺見方。

sentences.english: His heart fluttered with excitement as he was waiting for the reception by the leaders.
sentences.chinese: 他在等待領導人接見時激動得心怦怦直跳。

sentences.english: Finally he was seen by the ambassador.
In an interior city, both sides' leaders interviewed the diplomat.
sentences.chinese: 在一個內地城市，兩方領導人接見了外交官。

definition: to pay a visit/to call on
pay an official call/call on/visit in an official capacity
Premier Zhou Enlai 周恩來|周恩来 (1898-1976)
Deng Xiaoping (1904-1997), Chinese communist leader, de facto leader of PRC 1978-1990 and creator of "socialism with Chinese characteristics"
Chiang Ching-kuo (1910-1988), son of Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石, Guomindang politician, president of ROC 1978-1988
head of a (government etc) department/section chief/section head/secretary/minister/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]
